page.title: 06Population, Swainby & Potto
page.content: {Census}figures for Swainby and Potto in 1981 were 546 and 222, and have varied little since.{Swainby}populat- ion centres on the High Street with 64 houses averaging 2.3 people; an estate of 18 houses averages 2.0 and the OAP bungalows 1.4. Restriction of housing development has maintained an accept- able balance between established resi- dents and newcomers. In the block 36 families have children of school age or under but the number at the primary school, 78 in 1981 and 51 in 1983, is now only 37. Higher than average house prices mean that young couples usually start married life in larger villages nearer their places of work, and there is a high proportion of senior citizens.{Potto}has 27 families with children under 18 and 24 pensioners. There were 6 births, 8 marriages and 9 deaths in 1984 in the two villages.
